node.title: Disgraced WA public servant Paul Whyte sentenced to 12 years in jail over taxpayer theft
node.alt: A man in a blue shirt talks into a microphone.
node.description: The corrupt West Australian bureaucrat at the centre of Australia's single biggest case of public sector fraud will serve a minimum of 10 years behind bars for masterminding the theft of $27 million of taxpayers' money and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle.
node.content:
["The corrupt West Australian bureaucrat at the centre of Australia's single biggest case\u00a0of public sector fraud has been sentenced to 12 years in jail for\u00a0masterminding the theft of $27 million\u00a0of\u00a0taxpayers' money and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle.", "Paul Ronald Whyte, 58,\u00a0appeared at the sentencing hearing via video link from Hakea Prison, where he had\u00a0been held since he was taken\u00a0into custody.", "He was wearing prison greens and appeared to have lost weight during his two years behind bars.", "Whyte will have to serve 10 years behind bars before he is eligible for parole, and\u00a0with time already served, he will first be able to be released in 2029.", "He committed his crimes over 11 years while he was one of WA's top public servants in the state\u00a0government department that looks after public housing.", "But instead of ensuring that the state's most vulnerable people had access to a roof over their heads, he siphoned millions of dollars into his own accounts and used it to live beyond his means, including buying a riverside mansion and extravagant betting.", "The funds were taken through an elaborate fake invoice scheme, which\u00a0involved three shell companies \u2014 with no workforce or employees \u2014\u00a0repeatedly submitting false invoices to Whyte's\u00a0department.", "", "
Whyte's offending continued for over a decade.(ABC News: Hugh Sando)
", "The companies were not listed as official state government contractors, but the invoices \u2014\u00a0for various sums \u2014\u00a0were paid after being approved by Whyte, whose job it was to oversee the department's corporate operations.", "The funds were paid into accounts that Whyte had access to\u00a0and spent\u00a0on an extravagant lifestyle that was well beyond the means of what his public service salary would have allowed.", "Whyte continued his criminal enterprise without suspicion, but in August\u00a02018\u00a0WA's corruption watchdog received information about what it called \"questionable behavioural and lifestyle habits\".", "According to a Corruption and Crime Commission (CCC) report, tabled in the WA Parliament earlier this week, the information contained no allegations of criminality, but\u00a0given his senior position, it was\u00a0curious enough to prompt an investigation.", "It led to the CCC uncovering what it called \"Australia's biggest corruption by a public servant\".", "
Whyte apologises in court via lawyer
", "At the start of proceedings, Whyte's lawyer Michael Tudori\u00a0apologised on behalf of his client for the way he was dressed, saying Whyte\u00a0was \"a proud man\" but the fact he was in prison greens was beyond his control.", "Justice Joseph McGrath acknowledged Whyte had chosen to appear via video and said he understood his clothing was beyond his control.\u00a0", "", "
An artist's impression of Paul Whyte appearing in court via video link.(Supplied: Anne Barneston)
", "Mr Tudori said his client had asked him to \"sincerely apologise\" on his behalf to \"the members of his staff, to government departments ... and to the people of WA\" for what he had done.", "Mr Tudori said Whyte was also extremely sorry about the impact of his actions on\u00a0his family.", "Whyte bowed his head and appeared to become emotional as Mr Tudori detailed the shame his family had suffered, and how his three children had part-time jobs to help pay the rent for where they now lived.", "", "
Whyte's lawyer Michael Tudori told the court his client had asked him to\u00a0\"sincerely apologise\" on his behalf.(ABC News: Hugh Sando)
", "Whyte also admitted\u00a0a series of money-laundering charges relating to payments totalling almost $5 million\u00a0to the company of an associate, for work supposedly done for government projects.", "The court heard the associate had approached Whyte asking for government work because the company was struggling financially, but no work was actually done in return for the funds.\u00a0", "It was estimated that despite the\u00a0misappropriated funds\u00a0totalling\u00a0$27 million, the benefit Whyte received was only $11 million.", "State Prosecutor Michael\u00a0Cvetkoski told the court of the money taken, $5.1 million had been recovered, leaving an outstanding sum of more than $22 million which was unlikely to ever be recovered.", "Mr Tudori said some restitution had been made to the state, with the family home being sold as well as his interests in\u00a0racehorses, which he said were effectively sold in \"a fire sale\".", "Mr Tudori also said Whyte had surrendered all the superannuation he had accumulated over his 37-year career in the public sector.", "
Funds spent on racehorses, gambling
", "An obsession with racehorses appears to have been at the core of Whyte's offending.", "The CCC discovered that since 1998, Whyte\u00a0had interests in 87 of them \u2014 with 75 per cent\u00a0of the horses acquired after he started work in the public sector.", "", "
The CCC labelled Whyte's crimes \"Australia's biggest corruption by a public servant\".(ABC News: Benjamin Gubana)
", "Of the funds stolen by Whyte, Mr Cvetkoski said\u00a0it was estimated $3.7 million had been spent on his interest in racehorses.", "Mr Cvetkoski said Whyte had also helped determine that over the 11 years of his offending, he had purchased an\u00a0interest in at least 111 racehorses.", "There were also payments to various betting agencies totalling $813,102, but with\u00a0net losses of around $732,000.", "Another gambling account\u00a0opened in 2017\u00a0was in Whyte's partner's name and had losses of $88,500.", "While Whyte\u00a0did manage some modest winnings from his racehorse interests, the CCC\u00a0revealed they were not enough to explain his lifestyle, which included household spending between 2012 and 2019 totalling almost $1.1 million \u2014\u00a0or on average, about $160,000 a year.", "There was also the purchase of a $3 million\u00a0riverside mansion in the upmarket western Perth suburb of Mosman Park.", "", "
Whyte's house in the exclusive suburb of Mosman Park was the target of police raids.(ABC News: Rick Harvey)
", "It was not subject to a mortgage and the funds that were used in the purchase did not pass through bank accounts linked to Whyte or his partner, in whose name the property was registered.", "It was where the family lived despite the electoral roll, Whyte's driver's licence, vehicle registrations and banking records showing they lived at another address in the same suburb.", "Despite all these anomalies, the CCC said it was still \"struggling to establish how his lifestyle was funded\" and if there was \"any serious misconduct linked to his role as a public officer\".", "
Scale of fraud revealed after arrest
", "It was not until August 2019, after months and months of work, that there was a breakthrough when an analysis of Whyte's government-issued credit cards\u00a0found matches with payments to the shell companies he controlled.", "The CCC investigation was expanded and given the name Operation Taurus.", "Covert surveillance teams were used to monitor Whyte's activities and he was seen making withdrawals from the accounts linked to his shell companies.", "Within weeks, it was established by the CCC that he had been personally authorising the payment of false invoices to the companies that had provided no products, no services and no work to the government.", "", "
Police raided Whyte's Mosman Park home in November 2019.(Supplied: WA Police)
", "At that time, it appeared the fraud had been going on for only two years and involved about $2.5 million.", "The CCC, which does not have the power to lay charges or prosecute people, briefed WA Police in October 2019, leading to Whyte's arrest a month later after a raid on his home.", "Whyte appeared in court and was granted bail, but as the investigation\u00a0continued it became apparent the scale of his corruption was going to be huge.", "Three days later, Whyte was rushed to hospital after attempting to take his own life.", "As he was treated over the following weeks, he gave lengthy interviews to police from his hospital bed, detailing what he had done.", "As the number of charges he was facing blew out to more than 500 and the sum of money stolen grew, his lawyer signalled Whyte's intention to plead guilty.", "It was also around that time that despite having bail of $1.5 million, Whyte\u00a0decided to remain in custody to start serving what was inevitably going to be the lengthy jail term that he received today."]
